answerText: Central African Republic [accept République centrafricaine or Centrafrique or Ködörösêse tî Bêafrîka][10] Bangui is on this river, whose basin covers most of the country. It forms the southern border and flows into the Congo. The French used this river's name in conjunction with the Shari to name their colony.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Penn | 21 | Geography | None | College
subject: Geography
question: Question: This country's southwestern region of Lobaye produces much of its profitable coffee crop. For 10 points each: [10] Name this landlocked country whose capital is Bangui.
